title: Retinitis pigmentosa
summary: Retinitis pigmentosa (RP) is a genetic disorder of the eyes that causes loss of vision.[1] Symptoms include trouble seeing at night and decreased peripheral vision (side vision).[1] As peripheral vision worsens, people may experience "tunnel vision".[1] Complete blindness is uncommon.[2] Onset of symptoms is generally gradual and often in childhood.[1][2]
